publicwhip.spmotion: * S2M-2530 Margaret Jamieson:Darvel Remembers Sir Alexander Fleming—That the Parliament congratulates the Community Council of Darvel on its organisation of events which remember the life of Sir Alexander Fleming who was born at Lochfield Farm, Darvel, in 1881, discovered penicillin in 1928, was knighted in 1943, was awarded the Nobel Prize for Medicine in 1945 and died on 11 March 1955 and whose work as a research biologist continues to save lives across the world today. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S2M-2530 Darvel Remembers Sir Alexander Fleming (lodged on 7 March 2005) Dr Elaine Murray*, Michael Matheson*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S2M-2530 Darvel Remembers Sir Alexander Fleming (lodged on 7 March 2005) Mr David Davidson*, Alex Neil*, Donald Gorrie*

S2M-2530 Margaret Jamieson:Darvel Remembers Sir Alexander Fleming—That the Parliament congratulates the Community Council of Darvel on its organisation of events which remember the life of Sir Alexander Fleming who was born at Lochfield Farm, Darvel, in 1881, discovered penicillin in 1928, was knighted in 1943, was awarded the Nobel Prize for Medicine in 1945 and died on 11 March 1955 and whose work as a research biologist continues to save lives across the world today. Supported by: Dr Elaine Murray, Michael Matheson, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr David Davidson, Alex Neil, Donald Gorrie
S2M-2530 Darvel Remembers Sir Alexander Fleming (lodged on 7 March 2005) Fiona Hyslop*

S2M-2530 Darvel Remembers Sir Alexander Fleming (lodged on 7 March 2005) Colin Fox*, Murdo Fraser*, Eleanor Scott*, David Mundell*, Bill Butler*, Scott Barrie*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Jackie Baillie*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Bruce Crawford*, Tricia Marwick*, John Scott*, Tommy Sheridan*, Campbell Martin*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Rob Gibson*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Ms Sandra White*, Margaret Mitchell*, Karen Gillon*, Sarah Boyack*, Nora Radcliffe*, Brian Adam*, Maureen Macmillan*, Richard Lochhead*

S2M-2530 Darvel Remembers Sir Alexander Fleming (lodged on 7 March 2005) Phil Gallie*, Robin Harper*, Karen Whitefield*
S2M-2530 Darvel Remembers Sir Alexander Fleming (lodged on 7 March 2005) Dr Jean Turner*
